isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - CHASSIS ACCESSORIES - DESCRIPTION - Two Speed Axle wiring With Manual or Non-Electronic Automatic Transmission

svcproc.title: Two Speed Axle wiring With Manual or Non-Electronic Automatic Transmission
svcproc.para: A two speed rear axle is used when deep gear reduction and higher speeds are required. The axle is shifted with an air cylinder or electric motor depending on option. The two speed axle wiring provides a voltage signal to the engine electronic control module (ECM), so the speedometer and odometer will correctly measure speed and mileage when the rear axle assembly is shifted to a different gear ratio.

The command to change ranges is given by the driver when he moves a switch on the gear shift lever (manual transmission) or the switch on the instrument panel (with non-electronic Allison transmission).
